conclusion: To find the work done by the gas, calculate the area enclosed by the cycle on the PV diagram.
A to B is a vertical line where volume changes from 2 L to 5 L at constant pressure (1 x 10^5 Pa).
Work done from A to B is calculated as W_AB = 1 x 10^5 x (5 - 2) = 3 x 10^5 Joules.
B to C is a horizontal line where pressure changes from 4 x 10^5 Pa to 1 x 10^5 Pa at constant volume (5 L).
Work done from B to C is 0 since volume does not change.
C to A is a slanted line where pressure changes from 1 x 10^5 Pa back to 1 x 10^5 Pa, returning to initial volume (2 L).
Work done from C to A is calculated using trapezoidal area formula.
Total work done W_total = W_AB + W_BC + W_CA = 3 x 10^5 + 0 - 7.5 x 10^5 = -4.5 x 10^5 Joules.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings is -4.5 x 10^5 Joules, indicating surroundings do work on the gas.
